title.justification: The paper's title clearly indicates its focus on open-set anomaly detection in the context of multivariate time series.

extractions.description: This paper targets the open-set time-series anomaly detection (OSAD) problem, where a small number of labeled anomalies are used during training to enhance anomaly detection performance. The authors introduce MOSAD, a multi-head framework incorporating Generative, Discriminative, and Anomaly-Aware Contrastive heads, to effectively detect both seen and unseen anomaly classes. Experiments on three real-world datasets (SMD, PTB-XL, and TUSZ) demonstrate MOSAD\'s superior performance over existing unsupervised and supervised TSAD methods, establishing a new state-of-the-art in the field.

type.justification: The paper presents a novel model and conducts extensive experiments to validate its performance, demonstrating its empirical nature.
type.quote: Extensive experiments on three realworld datasets establish MOSAD as a new state-of-the-art in the TSAD field.

name.justification: The paper explicitly focuses on Time-series anomaly detection (TSAD), emphasizing its application in an open-set setting.
name.quote: This paper is the first to address the open-set TSAD problem, in which a small number of labeled anomalies are introduced in the training phase in order to achieve superior anomaly detection performance compared to both supervised and unsupervised TSAD algorithms.

name.justification: The paper names the proposed model as MOSAD, which stands for Multivariate time-series Open-Sset Anomaly Detector.
name.quote: To address this gap, we propose the first open-set TSAD algorithm named Multivariate time-series Open-Sset Anomaly Detector (MOSAD).

is_contributed.justification: The authors present MOSAD as a novel contribution, outlining its architecture, components, and advantages in detail.
is_contributed.quote: To address this gap, we propose the first open-set TSAD algorithm named Multivariate time-series Open-Sset Anomaly Detector (MOSAD).

is_executed.justification: The paper provides extensive experimental results, demonstrating MOSAD's effectiveness on three real-world datasets and comparing it to various baselines.
is_executed.quote: Extensive experiments on three realworld datasets establish MOSAD as a new state-of-the-art in the TSAD field.

is_compared.justification: The paper proposes and describes the MOSAD model for open-set time-series anomaly detection, highlighting its superior performance compared to existing methods.
is_compared.quote: To address this gap, we propose the first open-set TSAD algorithm named Multivariate time-series Open-Sset Anomaly Detector (MOSAD).

referenced_paper_title.justification: The model is proposed in this paper, hence no referenced paper title.
